definition[0]: to make someone become unconscious or go to sleep
example[0]: The champion knocked Biggs out in the seventh round.
example[1]: The nurse gave me some medicine which totally knocked me out.
example[2]: His head hit a table as he fell and he knocked himself out.
definition[1]: to defeat a person or team in a competition so that they can no longer take part
example[3]: The German team were knocked out in the first round.
example[4]: He first hit the headlines when he knocked Becker out of the French Open Tournament.
definition[2]: to damage something so that it does not work
example[5]: The air raids were planned to knock out communications on the ground.
definition[3]: if something knocks you out, it is very impressive and surprises you because it is so good
example[6]: She loved the movie. It knocked her out.
definition[4]: to produce something easily and quickly
example[7]: Paul has been knocking out new songs for the album.
definition[5]: to work very hard in order to do something well
definition[6]: to produce a lot of something
example[8]: Priceâ€™s Patent Candle Company has been knocking out candles at its London factory since 1831.
definition[7]: if something knocks out a system, machine etc it stops it working
example[9]: Fluctuations in the mains power supply knocked out the computer which normally logs all changes in operations.
